intro: Dortmanna acutidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Dortmanna, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, calcareous soils in temperate regions. Dortmanna acutidens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
